**What is the difference between bar chart and histogram chart?**
> The histogram is a graphical representation of data in rectangular bars that display frequency numerical data.
> The bar chart is a diagrammatical presentation of data by the use of bars to compare different categories of data.
> The histogram represents quantitative data whereas bar graphs represent categorical data.
> The elements in the histogram are grouped together as entities whereas elements in bar graphs are grouped individually.
> Histogram show distribution of non-discrete variables while bar graph show the distribution of discrete variables.
